channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Congressional staff warned of first missed paycheck as shutdown enters second month
item.description: U.S. House staffers were warned by congressional administrators Wednesday that their October paychecks will not be sent out if the government remains ...

item.title: "I guess I'm not allowed to run": Trump concedes third term won't happen
item.description: President Trump acknowledged Wednesday that "it's pretty clear" he can't be elected a third time, after months of teasing a run in 2028. The big pictu...

item.title: Behind the Curtain: How an AI jobs apocalypse unfolds
item.description: One of the most important real-time, real-world debates in America is whether AI causes a short-term job apocalypse among white-collar workers. Two de...

item.title: The job market may be at a tipping point
item.description: A slew of major companies announcing large-scale layoffs serves as a warning that the U.S. labor market, which has been in a prolonged-but-precarious ...

item.title: Israel resumes Gaza ceasefire after 104 Palestinians killed in airstrikes
item.description: The Israeli military announced Wednesday it would resume compliance with the ceasefire in Gaza after a night of airstrikes that killed more than 100 P...

item.title: De Blasio impostor tricks newspaper into running anti-Mamdani quotes
item.description: The Times of London apologized and said someone duped its reporter by claiming to be former New York mayor Bill de Blasio and criticizing Zohran Mamda...

item.title: Confident Xi to meet Trump at tenuous time in U.S.-China trade war
item.description: The Chinese leader looks confident ahead of the meeting in South Korea, striking a deal that will largely wind back to the clock to before Trump’s tar...

item.title: Democrats ramp up probes into Trump’s $300 million White House ballroom
item.description: Lawmakers are demanding answers about the project’s financing and what donors have been promised. The White House has defended its use of private dona...

item.title: In South Korea, Trump secures a trade deal — and a glittering crown
item.description: The trade agreement will lower U.S. tariffs on Korean cars and parts to 15 percent in exchange for $350 billion in investment, a Korean official said.

item.title: Trump says it’s ‘pretty clear’ he can’t run for a third term
item.description: Trump, 79, has for months openly mused about serving beyond January 2029, when he is scheduled to leave office.

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
